sources.title: Queen of Broadway (1942) ROMANCE
sources.description:
Movie Classic by PizzaFLIX: Rochelle Hudson signed her first Hollywood contract in 1930 when she was just 14 years old and went on to appear in over 75 films. She is perhaps best remembered today as Natalie Wood's mother in “Rebel Without a Cause.” 

Stars: Rochelle Hudson, Buster Crabbe, Paul Bryar
Director: Sam Newfield

Place your bet on Love! A well-respected sports team owner falls for a woman running a top gambling joint. He tries to win her heart by helping her adopt a newly orphaned young boy. Remember: LOVE is the important thing.

metadata.Plot: Sherry Baker (Rochelle Hudson), owner of a sports service (a bookie)is very successful and is highly respected by gamblers in New York City. Ricky Sloan (Buster Crabbe), owner of the Panthers professional football team, is in love with her. Jimmy Carson (Donald Mayo), a six-year-old boy, comes into Sherry's office to place a bet for his mother, who dies shortly after sending Jimmy to place her bet. Sherry reluctantly takes the kid home with her and, after a short while, decides to adopt him. But the court does not approve of Sherry's business, as it is more than somewhat illegal.
metadata.Actors: Rochelle Hudson, Buster Crabbe, Paul Bryar
